item.title: Hytale Early Access Release Date Set for January After Creator Revival
item.content:encoded:
Voxel sandbox game Hytale has been given a January Early Access release date, just over a week after its original creators announced its revival.

Hypixel Studios confirmed the news earlier today via the official Hytale website, on which it was revealed that the game will be launching into Early Access on PC on January 13th. Pre-orders will begin on December 13th.

Despite that, Hypixel says you shouldn't pre-order the game "if you don't feel comfortable" doing so. The studio is clear on the fact that Hytale will very much be an Early Access release, which means it'll be "unfinished" and "buggy for a while". Caveat emptor, and all that.

In the post, Hypixel reiterates what it said last week as part of its announcement that Hytale had been revived, namely that the game will follow "the original vision from the 2018 trailer" and that the developer will be "returning to a four-year-old legacy build that had been abandoned".

As such, "some parts of the game will feel behind" when it launches in January, but despite that, Hypixel says "momentum is strong", so you can expect plenty of updates and communication from the developer throughout the Early Access period.

If you're the kind of person who wants to mod Hytale to make it your own, then you'll be pleased to know modding and creative tools will be available on day one of Early Access, even though they're "not where [Hypixel wants] them long term".

Hypixel closes by warning players that the Early Access build of Hytale will be "rough", but promises that "the path ahead matters more". It seems like it really is important to set your expectations accordingly here.

Hytale began life as a custom Minecraft server before being spun off into its own entity in 2018, with League of Legends and Valorant's Riot Games stepping in to purchase Hypixel in 2020.

However, the partnership between Hypixel and Riot ended earlier this year when the latter shut down the former and seemingly canceled Hytale, although the game has since risen from the ashes under the stewardship of some of the original server's co-founders.

You'll be able to check out Hytale when it launches on PC via Early Access on January 13th next year. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
